sentences.english: Today's careers offer more opportunity for extramarital affairs.
sentences.chinese: 当今的职业生涯为婚外情提供了众多的机会。

sentences.english: Munsch concedes people probably aren't 100 percent honest about their infidelity.
sentences.chinese: 穆切认为，人们或许不会一口承认自己的婚外情。

sentences.english: The most common are about affairs and money.
sentences.chinese: 最常见的是关于婚外情和钱。

sentences.english: Why did she have an affair?
This out-of-marriage love affair set the scene for their divorce.
sentences.chinese: 这段婚外情导致了他们的离婚。

sentences.english: Afterward, Edwards admitted that he had an affair with Rielle Hunter.
sentences.chinese: 随后，爱德华兹承认他和亨特有婚外情。

sentences.english: The novel begins with a case of family brokenness and adultery.
sentences.chinese: 小说的开场是一个家庭的破裂和婚外情。

sentences.english: Knew when Song Xiaoying the husband has extramarital affair unexpectedly, decisive divorce.
sentences.chinese: 当宋晓英知道了丈夫竟有婚外情，果断离婚。

definition: derailment (railway accident)/to leave the rails/fig. to overstep bounds/fig. to have an extramarital affair
sb who is romantically involved with sb already in a committed relationship/the other woman/the other man/third person/third party (in dispute)/disinterested party/number three in a list
domestic violence/abbr. for 家庭暴力[jia1 ting2 bao4 li4]
lit. the red apricot tree leans over the garden wall (idiom)/fig. a wife having an illicit lover
to carry on a clandestine love affair
emotion/sentiment/affection/feelings between two persons/CL:個|个[ge4],種|种[zhong3]
to marry for the second time/second marriage/second spouse
to do the splits (gymnastics)/(Tw) two-timing (in romantic relationships)/Taiwan pr. [pi1 tui3]
